item.name: Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs Committee

item.title: FAA Extension, Safety, and Security Act of 2016
To amend title 5, United States Code, to provide for an annuity supplement for certain air traffic controllers.

item.name: Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs Committee

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

item.name: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management

summary.text: This bill exempts retired air traffic controllers from a reduction to their Federal Employees Retirement System annuity supplement (on account of their earnings for work performed while entitled to the annuity after their separation from federal service) during any period in which they are employed full time as air traffic control instructors under contract with the Federal Aviation Administration.

bill.title: A bill to amend title 5, United States Code, to provide for an annuity supplement for certain air traffic controllers.

item.title: A bill to amend title 5, United States Code, to provide for an annuity supplement for certain air traffic controllers.
A bill to amend title 5, United States Code, to provide for an annuity supplement for certain air traffic controllers.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
